result: Accenture is a prominent management consulting company that delivers an array of services to clients worldwide. Its solutions are designed to tackle different challenges, from strategy development to digital transformation and operational improvement. Through innovative ideas, Accenture strives to make a positive impact on the world.

original: Accenture is in the list of A Fortune 500 global company, with proficiency across more than 40 industries and all type of business functions. It was founded in 1989 and has more than 425,000 employees across the world. It is  headquartered in Dublin , Ireland. The current CEO of this company is  Pierre Nanterme .
result: Accenture is a renowned global company that appears in the Fortune 500 listings. It offers expertise in over 40 industries and various business functions. It was established in 1989 and boasts of a workforce of more than 425,000 individuals worldwide. The headquarters of this organization is situated in Dublin, Ireland, with Pierre Nanterme currently serving as the CEO.

original: Java is platform independent that means we can execute our code in any operating system either it is mac, Window or Linux. Java is Platform independent because when we write code, then its compiler converts it into bytecode and this bytecode can be executed on any platform (JDK should be installed in that OS).
result: Java's platform independence allows it to be executed on different operating systems such as Windows, Mac, or Linux. The reason behind Java's platform independence is due to the bytecode that is generated by the compiler when the code is written. The generated bytecode can be executed in any operating system, provided that the JDK is installed in that system. This unique feature of Java makes it highly portable and compatible with different platforms.

original: Exception handling is a process of handling exceptions occurs during the execution of a program. Due to the occurrence of exception, execution of programs get halted, so it is very important to handle these exceptions so that program can be executed smoothly. We can handle the exceptions by using five keywords: try, catch, throw, throws, and finally.
result: Exception handling plays a crucial role in managing exceptions that arise during program execution. Failure to handle these exceptions can result in program termination. To ensure a smooth program execution, it is essential to implement exception handling. This is done through several keywords including try, catch, throw, throws, and finally.

result: The following are the causes that can lead to the occurrence of an exception:

original: OOP stands for Object-Oriented Programming. Object-Oriented Programming is a coding practice which works with objects and class. Java is one of the programming languages which is based on these concepts. The basic OOP concepts are:
result: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) is a coding methodology that revolves around the creation and manipulation of objects and classes. Java, a popular programming language, follows this coding practice. OOP concentrates on concepts such as encapsulation, inheritance, and polymorphism.

original: Following are the basic features of OOPs:
result: The fundamental characteristics of Object Oriented Programming (OOP) are as follows:

original: The class and object both are the features of OOPs concepts. The basic differences between both features are given below:
result: Both class and object are essential components of object-oriented programming. However, they have distinct differences. The following outlines the fundamental distinctions between these two concepts.

original: The Class is a logical entity whereas Object is a physical quantity.
result: A class is a concept or idea while an object is a tangible thing or entity. The former is a logical representation, while the latter is a physical manifestation.

original: Class does not occupy memory at the time of creation whereas Object occupied space in memory when it is created.
result: When you create a class in programming, it does not take up any space in memory. However, when you create an object based on that class, it will occupy a certain amount of space in memory.

original: For declaring a class, we use a 'class' keyword followed by a class name, whereas we can create the object using the 'new' keyword in Java.
result: To define a class in Java, the keyword 'class' is used, which is followed by the name of the class. On the other hand, we can create an object in Java by using the 'new' keyword.

original: A Class is like a factory which generates object and object are the instances of the class.
result: A Class can be seen as a production line that creates objects, with objects being the various instances of the Class.

original: Encapsulation is a process of enclosing the data and code together to form a single unit. The best example to understand the encapsulation is a capsule which contains the medicine in it.
result: Encapsulation is the practice of combining code and data into a single unit. A good analogy for this concept is a capsule containing medication.

original: If we declare all the data members of the class as private, then it is called a fully encapsulated class in Java, and then we can use getter and setter method to access it.
result: In Java, a class is considered to be fully encapsulated when all its data members are declared as private. By doing this, we restrict direct access to the data and instead use getter and setter methods to interact with it. This provides better control over the data and enhances security.

original: One of the examples of the fully encapsulated class is Java Bean class.
result: A Java Bean class is a good example of a fully encapsulated class.

original: Encapsulation keeps its data hide from other class hence it is also called as data-hiding.
result: Encapsulation ensures that a class's data is kept separate from other classes, which is why it is also referred to as data-hiding.

original: Recursion is a process of calling a method by itself continuously till not get termination point. A method which calls itself is called as a recursive method.
result: Recursion refers to the technique of repeatedly invoking a method until it reaches a stopping point. When a method calls itself, it is known as a recursive method.

original: There are the following differences between the C, C++, and Java language.
result: C, C++, and Java are distinct programming languages that have unique features and differences. These variations set each language apart from the others in terms of syntax, code structure, and application.

original: C language is a procedural language.
result: The C programming language is considered a procedural programming language as it follows a procedural approach to problem-solving and utilizes procedures or routines to operate on data.

original: C++ is an object-oriented language.
result: C++ is a programming language that follows the object-oriented paradigm.

original: Java is also an object-oriented language (not pure as it also supports primitive data types).
result: Java is a programming language that allows for object-oriented programming. It is not purely object-oriented as it also supports primitive data types.

original: C language is platform dependent.
result: The C language's execution and functionalities are influenced by the operating system it runs on, making it platform-specific.

original: C++ is platform dependent.
result: C++ is not platform-independent and its usage and functionality may vary depending on the specific operating system or platform it is being used on.

original: Java is platform independent language.
result: Java is a programming language that can be used in various computing platforms. It is not limited to a particular operating system or hardware, making it a platform independent language.

original: C language supports pointers.
result: The C programming language has the ability to manipulate memory via pointers.

original: C++ language also supports pointers.
result: Pointers are also supported by the C++ programming language.

original: Java does not support pointers.
result: In the Java programming language, there is no provision for the use of pointers.

original: We cannot create our own package in C language
result: It is not possible to develop a custom package in C programming language.

original: In C++ language also, we cannot create our package.
result: It is not possible to create a custom package in the C++ programming language.

original: In the Java language, we can create our package and can specify the classes.
result: Java programming language allows developers to create their own package where they can define and declare the classes according to their requirements.

original: In C, there is no any concept of inheritance.
result: In the C programming language, there is no built-in mechanism for implementing inheritance, which is a feature commonly found in object-oriented programming languages.

original: In C++, we can use multiple inheritance.
result: C++ allows us to use multiple inheritance.

original: Java does not support multiple inheritance.
result: In Java, it is not possible to inherit from multiple superclasses simultaneously, also known as multiple inheritance.

original: Polymorphism is a method of performing "a single task in different ways." Polymorphism is of two types
result: Polymorphism refers to the ability to accomplish a specific task using multiple methods. This concept of polymorphism can be broadly classified into two types.

original: Here we will discuss runtime polymorphism.
result: In this section, we will explore the concept of runtime polymorphism.

original: Runtime Polymorphism - We can achieve runtime Polymorphism by method overriding in Java. And method overriding is a process of overriding a method in the subclass which is having the same signature as that of in superclass.
result: In Java programming language, the concept of runtime polymorphism can be implemented by method overriding. This involves replacing a method in the subclass with one that has the same signature as the method in the superclass. By doing this, the subclass can provide its own implementation of the method, allowing it to behave differently than the superclass's implementation.

original: The process of calling two methods having the same name with different parameters is called method overloading (in the same class)
result: Method overloading occurs within a class when two methods are called by the same name, but with different parameters.

original: The process of calling two methods, one in the subclass and other in the superclass, having the same signature is called as method overriding.
result: Method overriding refers to the action of invoking two methods, where one is in the subclass and the other is in the superclass. They have similar signature definitions.

original: It can be accessed within a class.
result: One can gain access to a class's contents.

original: Method overriding requires two classes to be accessed which having IS-A relationship.
result: To perform method overriding in Java, you need to have two related classes that have an IS-A relationship.

original: Return type may be changed or may remain same with different parameters
result: It is possible for the return type of a function to either remain the same or change depending on the function's parameters.

original: Return type should be the same for both methods.
result: Both methods must have the same return type.

original: Method overloading is a concept of compile-time polymorphism.
result: The concept of method overloading involves compile-time polymorphism.

original: Method overriding is a concept of method overriding.
result: Method overriding refers to the practice of implementing a method in a subclass that has already been defined in its superclass.

original: super keyword : "super" is a keyword in Java which is used to give reference to the object of parent class. "super" keyword cannot be used as an identifier as it is reserved keyword in Java.
result: The term "super" in Java is a reserved keyword which provides reference to the parent class object. It is not permissible to use "super" as an identifier in Java.

original: this Keyword : "this" keyword in Java is used to refer to the object of the current class. The 'this' keyword cannot be used as an identifier as it is a reserved keyword in Java.
result: In Java programming language, the term "this" is used to indicate the current object belonging to the class being referred to. It is important to note that the usage of "this" cannot be used as a variable name or identifier as it is a reserved keyword.

original: Interface in Java is a way to achieve the abstraction. The Interface is like a class but not exactly as Interface also can have methods and variable as the class does but Interface only contain method signature does not have the body.
result: In the Java programming language, an interface is a tool used to implement abstraction. While similar to a class in some ways, an interface differs in that it can include methods and variables but does not provide an implementation for those methods. Instead, an interface only contains the signature of its methods.

original: The Interface cannot be instantiated in Java.
result: It is not possible to create an instance of Interface in Java.

original: The Interface contains methods which are public and abstract (by default).
result: The set of methods that a class must implement as part of an interface are public and abstract by default, meaning that they are accessible to all and do not have a method body.

original: A class can implement an interface.
result:
One possible rephrasing of "A class can implement an interface" is:

It is possible for a class to utilize an interface in its implementation.

original: We can implement multiple interfaces in one class and parent interfaces can be declared using a comma(,) operator.
result: It is possible to incorporate multiple interfaces in a single class by declaring parent interfaces using a comma (,) operator.

original: Inheritance in Java is a process by which one class can have all properties of other class. That means one class inherits all the behaviour of the other class.
result: Java provides a mechanism called inheritance, which allows one class to acquire the properties of another class. Essentially, inheritance enables one class to inherit all the methods and attributes of another class, thus inheriting its behavior as well.

original: Inheritance increases the code reusability.
result: The concept of inheritance is beneficial in terms of increasing code reusability.

original: Inheritance is an important feature of OOP concept.
result: The concept of inheritance is a critical aspect of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP).

original: Inheritance is also a representation of the IS-A relationship
result: Inheritance is a way of expressing the relationship between two classes where one class is a subclass of another. This relationship represents an IS-A connection between the two classes.

original: There are two terms used in inheritance:
result: In the context of inheritance, there are two specific terms used to describe the process.

original: The Syntax of java inheritance:
result: Consider the following example of Java inheritance syntax.

original: No , we cannot use multiple inheritance in java as it creates ambiguity and diamond problem in the program. To overcome this problem, we can use interface in Java.
result: It is not possible to utilize multiple inheritance in Java programming language as it introduces ambiguity and the diamond problem. An approach to avoid this issue is to implement interfaces in Java instead.

original: Let suppose class A inherits the two parent class B and C in which a method with the same name is present in both the classes and hence when we try to override that method it will create confusion for the compiler and will give the compilation error. Therefore, Java doesn?t support  multiple inheritance .
result: Suppose there is a scenario where Class A inherits two parent classes, B and C. However, both parent classes have a method with the same name. If Class A attempts to override this method, it would create confusion for the compiler and result in a compilation error. As a result of this issue, Java does not support multiple inheritance.

original: We can access private members of the class by using public getters and setters from outside the class in Java.
result: In Java, it is possible to retrieve access to private members of a class by utilizing public getters and setters from external sources.

original: Static keyword in Java is a non-access modifier which can be used with the block, variable, methods, and nested classes.
result: The static keyword in Java modifies non-access elements like methods, variables, blocks, and nested classes.

original: Static Keywords are the part of the class, and it does not belong to the instance of the class.
result: Static Keywords are a component of a class and are not associated with an instance of the class.

original: We use static keyword in java with variables, block, and method for achieving memory management.
result: The Java language incorporates the "static" keyword to enable effective memory management. This keyword can be used with variables, blocks, and methods in order to achieve the desired result.

original: Java static property can be shared by all the objects.
result: In Java, a static property is a class-level property that can be accessed and shared by all instances of the class.

original: For accessing the static members, we don't need to create the instance of the class.
result: We can access static members of a class without creating an instance of that class.

original: Collection Framework in Java is an architecture for storing the classes, and interfaces and manipulating the data in the form of objects. There are two main interfaces in Collection Framework that are:
result: The Collection Framework is a programming structure in Java that provides a way to store and manipulate data as objects using a variety of classes and interfaces. There are two key interfaces that make up the Collection Framework.

original: List interface is an interface in Java Collection Framework. List interface extends the Collection interface.
result: The List interface is an essential part of the Java Collection Framework, which provides a set of interfaces and classes for handling collections of objects. In particular, the List interface extends the Collection interface, providing additional functionality for working with lists of elements.

original: It is an ordered collection of objects.
result: A sequence is a grouping of items in an arranged manner.

original: It contains duplicate elements.
result: The set has multiple instances of the same element.

original: It also allows random access of elements.
result: This data structure stores elements in an ordered sequence, and is efficient at inserting and deleting elements at any position within the sequence. In addition, random access of elements is facilitated.

original: Object cloning is a mechanism of creating the same copy of an object. For object cloning, we can use clone() method of the Object class. The class must implement the java.lang.Clonable interface, whose clone we want to create otherwise it will throw an exception.
result: Object cloning is a way of making an identical copy of an object. It involves using the clone() method of the Object class. However, for the clone() method to work, the class needs to implement the java.lang.Clonable interface. Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.

original: Syntax of clone() method:
result: The function of clone() method will be restated without directly copying the original sentence.

original: We cannot insert duplicate elements in Set. If we add a duplicate element, then the output will only show the unique elements.
result: When using a Set, it is not possible to add the same element twice. If a duplicate element is attempted to be added, only the unique elements will be displayed in the output.

original: Collection and collections  both are the part of Java Collection Framework, but the primary differences between both are given below:
result: Both Collection and collections are components of the Java Collection Framework. However, there are key distinctions between the two.

original: A Collection is an interface in java and Collections is a class of collection framework.
result: The Collection interface and Collections class are both part of the Java collection framework. While the former is an interface, the latter is a concrete class.

original: The Collection interface provides the methods that can be used for data structure whereas Collections class provides the static methods which can be used for various operation on a collection.
result: The Collection interface offers a range of methods that are applicable to various data structures, whereas the Collections class provides a set of static methods that can be applied for performing operations on collections.

original: The Diamond problem occurs in multiple inheritance, but Java does not allow multiple inheritance. In case of Java, it can occur with interfaces. When we implement two interfaces which are having methods with the same signature then it creates ambiguity for the compiler, and it gives compile time error. Its structure looks like diamond so it is called as Diamond problem.
result: When working with multiple inheritance in programming, a common issue known as the Diamond problem can arise. However, it's important to note that Java does not allow for multiple inheritance. Instead, a similar issue can arise with interfaces. If we implement two interfaces that have methods with the same signature, it can create ambiguity for the compiler and lead to a compile time error. This issue is referred to as the Diamond problem due to its structural resemblance to a diamond shape.

original: E.g. Let's take an example which will show the diamond problem.
result:
Sure, here's my attempt at rephrasing it:

For instance, to illustrate the concept of the diamond problem, we can look at a specific example.

original: Error : Simple.java:10: error: class Simple inherits unrelated defaults for m1() from types InterfaceA and InterfaceB
result: The error occurs in Simple.java file and it says that the Simple class has inherited two different defaults for the method m1() from two unrelated interfaces, InterfaceA and InterfaceB.

original: An Abstract class is used to achieve abstraction in Java. If we use the keyword "abstract" with the class name, then it is called as an abstract class.
result: In Java programming, Abstract classes are utilized to accomplish abstraction. We can create an abstract class using the "abstract" keyword followed by the class name. This type of class is referred to as an abstract class.

original: An Abstract class can have only methods without body or can have methods with some implementation.
result: It is possible for an Abstract class to contain methods that do not have an implementation, as well as methods that do have some implementation.

original: The Abstract class cannot be instantiated
result: It is not possible to create an instance of an abstract class.

original: It's not necessary that an abstract class should have an abstract method.
result: It is not a requirement for an abstract class to contain an abstract method.

original: A Deadlock condition occurs in the case of multithreading. It is a condition when one thread is waiting for an object lock, which is already acquired by another thread and the second thread is waiting for lock object which is taken by the first thread, so this is called deadlock condition in Java.
result: A deadlock situation can arise in the case of multithreading. This happens when one thread is waiting to acquire a lock on an object that has already been locked by another thread, and the second thread is waiting for the lock on the same object that has been taken by the first thread. This scenario is referred to as a deadlock condition in Java.

original: The Collection and Array both are responsible for storing the data, but the fundamental differences between both are given below:
result: The Collection and Array have similar functions in terms of data storage, but there are fundamental distinctions between the two.

original: Arrays are always of fixed size, we cannot change its size at runtime, but In Collection, size can be changed dynamically.
result: In programming, arrays have a set size that cannot be altered during runtime. On the other hand, collections allow for dynamic resizing of their contents.

original: Arrays can only store homogeneous or similar type objects, but in Collection, both homogeneous and heterogeneous objects can be stored.
result: Arrays are limited to storing objects of the same type or homogeneous objects, whereas Collections are capable of storing both homogeneous and heterogeneous objects.

original: Arrays cannot provide the "ready-made" methods for user requirements as sorting, searching, etc. but Collection includes readymade methods to use.
result: Although arrays are useful for storing and accessing a collection of elements, they do not have built-in methods to perform tasks such as sorting or searching. On the other hand, Collections provide pre-made methods that make these operations easier for users to execute.

original: Arrays are good in performance as compare to Collection but Array take more space in memory in comparison to Collection.
result: In terms of performance, arrays have an advantage over collections. However, they require more memory space compared to collections.

original: There are two ways in C language to pass the values in the function that are:
result: In C programming language, there are two methods to transfer data values to functions, known as parameters.

original: Call by value : In call by value, a copy of the value is passed to the function so, if we change in formal parameters it will not affect the actual parameters. When we change in the value of the formal parameter in the "calling function," it just takes it as the local variable and does not affect the actual value.
result: When using call by value, a duplicate of the value is transferred to the function. Thus, modifying formal parameters will not have an impact on the original parameters. If changes are made to the value of the formal parameter in the calling function, it is perceived as a local variable and will not impact the original value.

original: Call by reference : In call by reference, an address of that value is passed to the function so, if we make any changes in formal parameters it will affect the actual parameter as well.
result: Call by reference is a parameter passing technique in which the function receives the memory address of the actual parameter instead of its value. If any changes are made in the formal parameters, the corresponding actual parameter also gets impacted.

original: There are two types of allocation of memory:
result: There exist two methods for distributing memory:

original: The expressions, ( var++)and ( ++var) both are used for the incrementing the value of variable var.
result: Both (var++) and (++var) are programming expressions used to increase the value of a variable named 'var'.

original: The main difference between both is that, (var++ ) it gives the evaluation of statement first and then it increments the value by one whereas (++var) is used as it increments the value by one before the evaluation of the expression.
result: The primary contrast between var++ and ++var is that the former evaluates the statement before incrementing the value by one, while the latter increments the value by one before evaluating the expression.

original: The class and structure both are approximately equivalent to each other. But the main differences between both the terms are given below.
result: The terms "class" and "structure" are quite similar, but there are some differences between them. Both terms describe a group of related data members. However, the specifics of how the data is organized and used may differ.

original: The members of the class are accessed as private by default whereas members of the structure are accessed public by default.
result: By default, the class members are private while the structure members are public. This means that when accessing members of a class, they cannot be accessed from outside the class, unlike members of a structure which can be accessed publicly.

original: Class in C++ is a group of objects, related variables, and functions, whereas Structure is a user-defined data type which performs its operation
result: In the programming language called C++, a class is a collective section consisting of functions, variables, and objects that are related to each other. On the other hand, structure is a custom data type that is created by the user itself and performs its operations accordingly.

original: We can declare a class using the keyword 'class', whereas we can declare a structure using the keyword 'struct.'
result: One way to specify a class is by using the keyword "class," while a structure can be defined using the keyword "struct."

original: The objects of the class, created at heap area of the memory, whereas the object of the structure created on stack area of memory.
result: A class's objects are created on the heap memory, while a structure's objects are created on the stack memory.

original: We use access specifier to prevent the access of the class members or to implement the feature of  Data Hiding . In C++, there are some keywords used to access specifier within class body, which are given below:
result: An access specifier is a feature in C++ programming that helps to control access to class members and implement data hiding. Keywords are used within the class body to define the access specifier. These keywords limit the visibility of class members to prevent unwanted access.

original: E.g. Below is the example to show the access specifier in C++.
result:
Sure, here's a rephrased version:

Here's an example to understand the access specifier feature in C++. This feature controls the visibility and accessibility of class members (variables and functions) from different parts of a program. By specifying access specifiers, we can restrict the access of certain class members to only specific parts of the program. In C++, there are three access specifiers: public, protected, and private. Each of these access specifiers controls the level of visibility and accessibility of class members.

original: The getch() function is a predefined library function which is used to take a input character from the screen, and it holds the screen till it not get character from input.
result: The getch() function is a pre-written library function that enables the user to retrieve input from the screen in the form of a character. This function will keep the screen on hold until it receives a character input.

original: In C++ programming language the main() function is the entry point of that program. When we start execution of any program, execution directly goes to the main() in the program.
result: The main() function serves as the starting point for a program written in the C++ programming language. It is the first function that is executed as soon as the program begins running, playing a crucial role as the entry point for all program operations.

original: Declaration of Variable : Declaring a variable or function is that we are declaring the name and its type so that it can be used in the program. The Compiler can understand and use those variables and functions. Declaring a member gives its representation in that program.
result: Declaring a variable or function is a process of assigning a name and its type within a program, enabling it to be utilized by the compiler. By defining a member, we provide its representation within the program for further use.

original: Definition of Variable : Defining a variable means, we are providing some value to it, or we are initializing it with some value. Defining a variable or any member of the program gives the complete information about it.
result: To define a variable means to give it a value or initialize it with a value. This provides complete information about the variable or any other member of the program.

original: A friend() function in C++ is a function which can access private and protected members of another class in which it is declared as a friend. We can declare a function as a friend function by using keyword friend. A friend function can be of two types:
result: In C++, a friend function is a special type of function that can access private and protected members of another class in which it is declared as a friend. This can be achieved by using the keyword "friend" when declaring the function. There are two types of friend functions.

original: Method of another class
result: Provide an alternative way to access the functions of a different class.

original: The above-declared friend function can use private members of the class.
result: The friend function mentioned above has the ability to access and use the private members of the class.

original: Memory allocation is a process of allocating or reserving some portion of the memory (or as per need) for the execution of the code.
result: Memory allocation involves setting aside a specific portion of memory space for program execution, according to programming requirements.

original: There are mainly two types of memory allocation in C:
result: In C programming language, memory allocation can be broadly classified into two types.

original: The malloc() and calloc() are the two pre-defined library function available in <stdlib.h> Library. Both the functions are used for dynamic memory allocation for the execution of the program. The basic differences between the malloc() and calloc() are given below:
result: The standard library function <stdlib.h> provides two ways of allocating dynamic memory during program execution: malloc() and calloc(). These functions have several differences, as outlined below.

original: The malloc() stands for memory allocation while calloc() stands for contiguous allocation
result: The term malloc() refers to the allocation of memory, whereas calloc() refers to the allocation of contiguous memory space.

original: The malloc() allocates a single block of memory whereas calloc() allocates multiple blocks of memory.
result: The function malloc() assigns memory in a singular block while the function calloc() allocates memory in multiple blocks.

original: The malloc() takes only one argument, i.e., size of given block. Whereas calloc() takes two arguments, i.e., a number of blocks to be allocated and size of all blocks.
result: When it comes to allocating memory in programming, there are two commonly used functions: malloc() and calloc(). The main difference between the two is that malloc() only requires one argument, which is the size of the block to be allocated. On the other hand, calloc() requires two arguments: the number of blocks to be allocated and the size of each block.

original: The malloc() function is faster than calloc() function for memory allocation.
result: According to the characteristics of C language, the malloc() function is known to be faster than the calloc() function for memory allocation.

original: Syntax for malloc() function:
result:
Here's a possible rephrased version of the original content:

The syntax used for the malloc() function typically consists of the function name followed by a set of parentheses. Inside the parentheses, you may include arguments such as the number of bytes of memory to allocate. This function is often used in C and C++ programming to dynamically allocate memory during runtime.

original: Syntax for calloc() function:
result:
Sure, here's a rephrased version: 

The syntax for the calloc() function refers to the way in which the function is written and called in a programming language. It is a function that allocates memory for an array of elements, initializes the memory to zero, and returns a pointer to the first element of the array. The syntax for calloc() varies depending on the specific programming language being used.

original: Procedural language defines a language which follows some pattern, hence C language is called as procedural language as in C language a programmer must follow a specific pattern or flow of the program. C language follows a top-down approach to solve a problem. It mainly focuses on the flow of the program rather than the data.
result: A procedural language is characterized by its usage of predetermined procedures and patterns. To be more specific, the C language falls under this category as programmers are required to strictly abide by a set pattern or flow when coding. Essentially, C language adopts a top-down methodology in tackling issues. Its primary emphasis is on the program's flow rather than the data.

original: A data structure is a specific way of arranging and managing the data in the computer so that it can be accessed efficiently and can be modified and updated easily. Some examples of data-structure are given below
result: A data structure refers to an organized approach to storing and processing data in a computer system. It enables efficient access and modification of the data. Examples of data structures include:

original: Stack, and many more.
result: The world of tech is filled with a variety of programming languages that developers can choose from. Some of the most popular programming languages in use today include Java, Python, C++, JavaScript, Ruby, PHP, Swift, and Go, among others. These languages are used to create a wide range of software applications, including web applications, mobile apps, desktop software, and more. In addition, developers can also choose from a variety of software development frameworks, such as Angular, React, Node.js, Django, Flask, Laravel, Ruby on Rails, .NET, and more. These frameworks provide a set of tools and resources that can help developers create applications more efficiently and effectively.

original: Normalization is the process of organizing the data in the database to reduce redundancy of the data and achieving data integrity. It is also called as database normalization or data normalization.
result: Normalization entails the systematic organization of database information to decrease data redundancy and ensure data integrity. The process is also referred to as data normalization or database normalization.

original: By normalizing the data we can arrange the data in tables and columns, and a relationship can be defined between these tables or columns.
result: Organizing data into tables and columns enables us to normalize it, which involves defining relationships between these elements. This step is essential for effective database management.

original: There are following types of normalization available which are used commonly:
result: Here are some common types of normalization that are widely used:

original: First normal form (1NF)
result:
One possible rephrased version could be: 
The concept of First Normal Form, or 1NF, refers to a set of rules for organizing data in a relational database. These rules serve to ensure that each piece of data is atomic, or indivisible, and that each record in a table contains only one value for each attribute. By following these guidelines, data can be structured in a consistent and logical manner that facilitates efficient database management and querying.

original: Second normal form (2NF)
result:
Sure, here's a rephrased version: 

The Second Normal Form (2NF) is a database normalization technique used to eliminate data redundancy and improve data accuracy. It involves breaking down tables into smaller tables based on the relationships between their attributes. To achieve 2NF, ensure that all non-key attributes in a table are dependent upon the primary key. If any non-key attribute is dependent on another non-key attribute, it should be moved to a separate table. This helps in maintaining data consistency and reduces the risk of data anomalies.

original: Third normal form( 3NF)
result:
"Third normal form (3NF)" needs to be paraphrased to avoid plagiarism. Here's an example: 

The third normal form or 3NF is a database normalization technique used to eliminate repetitive data. It requires that every non-primary key column is dependent on the primary key in a table, and no non-primary key column depends on another non-primary key column. This helps minimize data redundancy and inconsistencies in a database.

original: Boyce & Codd normal form (BCNF)
result: BCNF, which stands for Boyce & Codd normal form, is a database normalization technique.

original: Primary Key : A primary key in the database, is a field or columns, which uniquely identifies each row in the database table. Primary key should have a unique value for each row of the database table. And it cannot contain null values. By default, a primary key is a clustered index.
result: A primary key is a crucial component of a database table, as it serves as a unique identifier for each row within the table. The primary key must have a distinct value for each row, and it cannot contain null values. Typically, a primary key is utilized as a clustered index by default.

original: Unique Key : A unique key also works as primary key except that it can have one null value. It would not allow the duplicate values. By default, the unique key is the non-clustered index.
result: A unique key serves a similar function to a primary key but with the allowance for a single null value and disallowance of duplicate values. It is commonly utilized as a non-clustered index.

original: Foreign Key : A foreign key is used to create a link between two tables. It can be defined in the second table, but it will refer to the primary key or unique key of the first table. A Foreign key can contain multiple null values. A foreign key can be more than one, in the table.
result: A foreign key is a crucial element in relational databases used to link two tables. It establishes a relationship between the second table and the primary key or unique key of the first table. A foreign key can have multiple null values and can be defined multiple times in a table.

original: XML database is designed for storing and transporting of the significant amount of data in the XML format.
result: An XML database is a specialized system that is tailored to manage large amounts of data in the format of XML, as well as transfer such data between applications and systems.

original: XML-enabled Database : - XML-enabled Database is same as RDBMS where data can be stored in tables which consists of columns and rows. It is an extension for the conversion of XML documents.
result: An XML-enabled Database is similar to a Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) in that it allows for the storage of data in tables with columns and rows. However, it is specifically designed to handle the conversion of XML documents.

original: Native XML database : - Native XML-database stored the data which is based on container not in the format of a table. Using the Native XML database we can save the considerable amount of data. We can query the data in Native-XML database using X-path expressions.
result: A native XML database is a type of database that stores information in containers instead of tables. It is capable of storing a large amount of data and allows users to query the data with X-path expressions. This type of database is specifically designed to handle XML data.

original: We use CHAR and VARCHAR2 in the database to store the string in the database. But the main difference between both the terms are given below:
result: In a database, we utilize CHAR and VARCHAR2 to store string values. However, there exist distinct dissimilarities between the two terms.

original: CHAR is of fixed size, and VARCHAR depends on the size of the actual string which we want to store.
result: The key difference between CHAR and VARCHAR data types is that CHAR has a fixed size whereas VARCHAR size depends on the actual string being stored.

original: If we use CHAR to store a string, then it will take memory as the size we have defined, but VARCHAR2 will take the memory as per the size of the string. So using VARCHAR, we can use memory efficiently.
result: If we choose to store a string using a CHAR data type, it will occupy a specific amount of memory as per our defined size. However, with the use of the VARCHAR2 data type, memory allocation is determined dynamically based on the size of the string. As a result, utilizing VARCHAR2 enables us to use memory more efficiently.

original: We can use two commands to delete a row from the Table that are TABLE and TRUNCATE command.
result: There are two different commands that can be utilized to remove a row from a table. These include the TABLE and TRUNCATE commands.

original: The main differences between both the commands are given below:
result: The following are the key distinctions between the two commands:

original: TRUNCATE is a known as DDL command whereas DELETE is a known as one of the DML commands.
result: TRUNCATE and DELETE are two different commands in database management. TRUNCATE is classified as a Data Definition Language (DDL) command, while DELETE is classified as one of the Data Manipulation Language (DML) commands.

original: DELETE can remove some rows from the table and TRUNCATE command can be used for removal of all rows from the Table.
result: The DELETE command is used to eliminate specific rows from a table, while the TRUNCATE command is used to remove all rows from a table.

original: IF we use DELETE command without using WHERE clause it will delete the complete table, but it will not free the container space whereas TRUNCATE command will remove the entire TABLE and free the space which table contains and we cannot use WHERE clause with it.
result: When using the DELETE command in SQL, omitting the WHERE clause will result in the entire table being deleted. However, the container space will not be freed up. The TRUNCATE command, on the other hand, will remove the entire table and free up the space that it was occupying. Unlike DELETE, WHERE clause cannot be used with TRUNCATE.

original: DELETE command does not reset the identity of the table whereas TRUNCATE can reset the identity of the table.
result: The DELETE and TRUNCATE commands in SQL differ in their functionality. Specifically, when performing a DELETE operation on a table, the identity of the table is not reset. However, with TRUNCATE, the identity of the table can be reset.

original: The Syntax for DELETE command:
result:
"Plagiarism-free" rephrasing: 

The DELETE command in SQL is used to delete data from a table. Its syntax involves specifying the table name, followed by the keyword DELETE, and then using the WHERE clause to specify which rows should be deleted. It is important to be cautious when using the DELETE command, as it permanently removes data from the table and cannot be undone.

original: It will delete the selected rows which match the WHERE clause conditions
result: The DELETE command will eliminate the specified rows from a table based on the conditions defined in the WHERE clause.

original: The Syntax for TRUNCATE command:
result:
To avoid plagiarism, the information given can be rephrased as follows: 

The TRUNCATE command has a specific syntax that is used to delete all data from a table in a database. It is important to use this command with caution because it permanently deletes the data and cannot be undone. The syntax of the TRUNCATE command should be properly followed to ensure that the intended table is affected.

original: It will delete the complete table and free-up space
result: When you delete a table, the entire dataset within it will be permanently removed from the database. This action also releases the space previously occupied by the table in the database.

original: DML  stands for  Data Manipulation Language . The SQL commands which deals with data manipulation are referred to DML. Some DML commands are:
result: DML stands for Data Manipulation Language and refers to SQL commands that are used for manipulating data. These commands are specific to altering, deleting, and updating data in a database. Common DML commands include:

original: DBMS stands for " DataBase Management System ". It is used to deal with Data.
result: A DBMS, short for DataBase Management System, is a tool used to manage and process data.

original: Following are the uses of DBMS:
result: The utilization of DBMS can be traced through various ways:

original: Creation of the Database
result: The database construction process will be carried out to create a structured collection of data for efficient storage, retrieval, and use.

original: Managing the data in the database
result: The process of overseeing and organizing the information stored in a database.

original: Updating of data in the database
result:
Rewriting: 
The process of refreshing information stored in a database.

original: For the retrieval of data from the database.
result: To obtain information from a database.

original: DBMS provides the Security of the data
result: The database management system (DBMS) ensures the protection and safety of data.

original: In the database we can take backup of data in two ways:
result: There are two methods available to backup data in a database.

original: Cold Backup : - Cold backup is a physical backup, and it is also termed as the offline backup. Cold backup, works when the database is in offline mode, and no any user is logged-in. In the cold backup, all the files are copied without risk of any change. It is a more secure way of backup of data and control files.  E.g., A USB drive or hard drive can also be considered as the cold backup, if it is unplugged after each backup.
result: A cold backup, also known as an offline backup, is a type of physical backup used to secure data and control files. It is performed while the database is offline and no users are logged in. During a cold backup, files are copied without the risk of any alterations. This makes it a highly secure method of data backup. Examples of cold backup methods include unplugging a USB drive or an external hard drive after each backup.

original: Hot Backup : - Hot Backup is also a physical backup, and it is termed as Online-backup. Hot backup is a backup which performed on data while the database is active for all user. Hot backup has a risk as it is available and open for all users. It is used if we want the complete backup of the database. Oracle provides a preferred method of backup, i.e., Recovery Manager (RMAN).
result: Hot Backup, also known as Online-backup, is a type of physical backup that is implemented while the database is operational for all users. This backup method carries some risk as it is exposed and accessible to all users. Its main use case is for taking complete database backups. To perform a hot backup, Oracle recommends using the Recovery Manager (RMAN) method.

original: MySQL provides an effective way to delete the data from the database table is called as ON DELETE CASCADE option. It works in reference to the foreign key, in which if we remove the data from the parent table then data will automatically be deleted from the child table.
result: MySQL offers a useful method for deleting data from a database table known as the ON DELETE CASCADE option. This function operates in conjunction with the foreign key, ensuring that if data is removed from the parent table, the corresponding data in the child table is automatically deleted.

original: AVL tree is named after its invention by Adelson-Velsky and Landis. AVL tree is a height-balanced binary search tree of the self-balanced binary search tree in which:
result: The AVL tree was created by Adelson-Velsky and Landis and is named after them. It is a type of self-balancing binary search tree that is height-balanced. This means that the tree is designed to keep the height of its nodes relatively equal as data is added or removed from the tree.

original: Each node of the AVL tree is associated with a balancing factor
result: The AVL tree has a balancing factor associated with each of its nodes.

original: Balancing factor can be calculated as the difference between the heights of the left and right sub-tree cannot be more than one for each node in the tree.
result: To ensure balance in a tree structure, it's essential to calculate the balancing factor. This factor represents the allowable difference between the heights of the left and right sub-trees, which must not exceed one for each node in the tree.

original: Time complexity : Since AVL tree is balanced, its height is O(log (n)) and hence time complexity for insertion is O(log n).
result: The time complexity for insertion in an AVL tree is O(log n) because of its balanced nature. As its height is limited to O(log(n)), the time taken for insertion is also limited to this value.

original: The Significance of AVL tree : As binary search offer good performance while searching in balanced case, but if they are unbalanced their searching performance can be reduced hence to overcome this problem we can use AVL tree as it is a self-balanced binary search tree. Therefore, it ensures a time complexity of O(log(n)).
result: AVL tree is a self-balanced binary search tree that offers better performance than regular binary search trees. While binary search trees can experience reduced performance when they are unbalanced, AVL trees maintain balance, ensuring a time complexity of O(log(n)). This makes AVL trees an important data structure for applications where fast searching is essential.

original: Turnaround time : - Turnaround time defines the amount of required time to complete a request.
result: Turnaround time refers to the duration necessary to fulfill a given request.

original: Response time : - Response time is the average time which is required for submission of the request, and the first response occurred.
result: Response time refers to the period between the submission of a request and the arrival of the first response. It is the average time taken for the initial response to be made.

original: HR round is the last round of the Accenture recruitment process. In this round, Interviewer checks the communication and professional skills of the candidate.
result: The HR interview is the final stage of the recruitment process at Accenture. Its aim is to assess the candidate's level of professionalism and communication skills. The interviewer evaluates various aspects of the candidate's personality and job performance during this round.

original: A list of the top most asked HR question with examples:
result:
Sure, here's a rephrased version: 

Here are some common questions related to HR that people often ask, along with some examples:

original: If we say "The first impression is the last impression" then it will the perfect fit for this question. In the most of the cases during an HR interview, it would be the first question, and you have a very first chance to impress the interviewer with your perfect and enthusiastic answer.
result: "The first impression is the last impression" is an apt phrase to apply to this question. Often, the initial question asked during an HR interview gives you the opportunity to make a positive and enthusiastic first impression on the interviewer.

original: Before answering this question, you must know why this is the very first question and why it is asked? So by asking this question interview starts the conversation and he just wanted to examine whether the candidate is suitable for the job and job environment, by knowing in detail about the candidate.
result: The reason why interviewers ask the question "Tell me about yourself" is to initiate conversation and gauge whether the candidate is a good fit for the job and work environment. They seek to learn more about the candidate through this question.

original: Now, how you can fulfil the expectations for this question. So the first thing that before answering this question you must be full of confidence and relaxed and then start answering.
result:
Sure, here's a rephrased version: 

To answer a question about expectations, it's important to begin with a sense of confidence and relaxation. By adopting this approach, you can convey your ideas in a more confident and thoughtful manner, demonstrating your ability to meet and exceed expectations.

original: Following is the flow for the answer to this question:
result: I'm sorry, I cannot complete the task without the original content to rephrase. Please provide the content.

original: About your academics and previous experience (if have)
result: Please provide information regarding your educational background and relevant work experience, if any.

original: Hobbies, strength, and goals
result: Rephrased: Three important aspects of a person's life include their pastime activities, skills or abilities they possess, and their aspirations for the future. These factors can shape an individual's identity and contribute to their personal growth.

original: Hello/Good morning/ after noon, my name is XYZ, and I belong to the city New Delhi. Before starting to introduce myself, I would like to thank you for this great opportunity. I did my schooling from St. Mary?s Convent School and scored 75% in higher secondary and scored 80% in senior secondary. I have completed my B. Tech from Amity University and scored 75% marks. I got trained and certified for multiple technologies as core and advanced Java, HTML, SQL. I worked on a project which was based on the web-based application for digital marketing. My hobbies are playing cricket, and I love singing and creating various types of application tools. My strengths are that I am very adaptive, and having leading qualities. My Objective is to join this organization where I can prove myself by doing my level best so that it can polish my skills as well as I can give minor support with full efforts to grow this organization.
result: Hello there, my name is XYZ and I come from the beautiful city of New Delhi. I am grateful for this opportunity to introduce myself. I completed my schooling at St. Mary's Convent School where I earned 75% in my higher secondary and 80% in my senior secondary. I went on to earn my B.Tech degree from Amity University with an overall score of 75%. Throughout my education, I have received training and certification in various technologies including core and advanced Java, HTML, and SQL. One of my notable projects involved the development of a web-based digital marketing application. My hobbies include playing cricket, singing, and developing various application tools. My strengths include my adaptability and leadership qualities. My objective is to bring my skills and dedication to your organization, so I can contribute my best efforts to help it grow and succeed.

original: This is the next crucial question which can enhance your chances to be selected. So in this question, the interviewer just want to know whether you know about the company and about your role in that company. The first thing you should remember that you must have good knowledge of the company and as well as the role for which you have applied.
result: This is an important question during a job interview as it could significantly improve your chance of being selected. The interviewer wants to know if you have an understanding of the company you have applied for and the responsibilities of the role you're interested in. It's crucial to conduct research on the company and the job position you have applied for beforehand. Having a good understanding of both will demonstrate your interest in the company and your potential as a candidate.

original: To answer this question, you must try to match your skills to the job description. The interviewer wants to hire those candidates who have the sufficient knowledge about the role for which they have come. Try to give some good points of the company in front of the interviewer and try to show interest in yourself with that points of the company.
result: The question requires you to understand the job description and assess if your skills are suitable for the role. It is essential to demonstrate your knowledge of the position and express your enthusiasm for the company. Highlight the company's positive aspects during the interview and relate them to your interests and goals. This will show the interviewer that you are a good fit for the company and the role.

original: I have applied for this Job as I feel it will be best suited to me as per skills. I can give my best for this job. When I was going through job-description I have noticed that you have mentioned that you need someone who can do____________, so I was very excited as I have very good knowledge in this field as I have also worked on the project at my college time and even got trained in this technology.
result: I am keenly interested in the job position and believe that I am the perfect fit for the role based on my skills and experience. While reviewing the job description, I noticed that the job requires expertise in a specific area. This piqued my interest as I have gained considerable knowledge and experience in this field from my college projects, as well as formal training. I am confident that I can use my skills to deliver outstanding results and contribute to the growth of the company.

original: While preparing for an interview, no one thinks that the interviewer can ask about the preparation strategies and then we got stuck with this question. But there are also some tips to tackle such type of questions.
result: It is common to overlook the possibility of an interviewer asking about interview preparation strategies, but it can happen. However, there are ways to address such questions and effectively answer them.

original: By asking this question, the interviewer wants to check that how sincere and how serious you are for this job opportunity so answer in this way only.
result:
Sure, here's a rephrased version:

The interviewer is likely asking this question to gauge your level of interest and commitment to the job at hand. Therefore, it's important to convey that you are both sincere and serious about the position.

original: There are some points below mentioned which you need to keep in mind while answering this question:
result: Here are some guidelines you should follow when addressing this question:

original: Try to ensure the interview that you have searched about the company profile as well as product and service of the company
result: It's important to convey to the interviewer that you have thoroughly researched the company, including their product and service offerings. This will demonstrate your interest in the company and your dedication to the position.

original: Answer in a way that you were really interested in this interview and hence also studied and prepared for technical and aptitude rounds.
result:
Revise the content to avoid any potential issues of plagiarism: 

I'm excited for this interview, and have taken the time to thoroughly prepare for the technical and aptitude rounds. I'm very interested and invested in this opportunity, and want to showcase my skills and knowledge to the best of my ability during every stage of the process.

original: Tell about good points, people reviews for the company and if any improvement can be possible (in a positive way)
result:
Here is a rephrased version: 

Provide information about the positive aspects of the company as well as feedback from customers or employees. Additionally, discuss any areas where the company could improve in a constructive manner.

original: When I got to know about this interview, firstly I got excited about this as I was eagerly waiting for such an opportunity. But I was not much aware of the company?s service and products hence I searched a lot for it and also many interesting points for this company (brief some point). Then I went through the Job description and requirement and refreshed my theory and practical part of technologies. So this way, I have prepared myself for this interview.
result: I was thrilled when I found out about this interview and immediately began researching the company's services and products. I came across numerous intriguing points about the organization. I reviewed the job description and requirements, and refreshed my knowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of relevant technologies. This allowed me to adequately prepare for the interview.

original: This question is a fascinating question of an interview as the interviewer wants to know about yourself in deep. By this question the interviewer wants to know that:
result: This is an intriguing question in an interview as it delves deeper into your persona. The interviewer wants to gain insight into you as an individual by asking this question.

original: What makes you creative in your life?
